posts.cooked:
So we’ve been having issues with our autonomous modes from time to time and have noticed that when it does so, our gyro (pigeon IMU) seems to not be reading anything as we don’t see it on our field 2d on shuffleboard.

For more details, basically what happens in our auto, on startup it does its first command (shoot) which doesn’t include any movement from the chassis. Then when it goes to follow its first path, it just starts rotating at full speed at the same time as moving. That’s why we think it might be the gyro.

Any help is appreciated, and we’ve checked electric connections and they’re secure, and the leds are orange (it’s connected to the CAN ). Thank you!

posts.name: Leo
posts.cooked: Could you post a link to your code? (GitHub, Gitlab, etc.)

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
My guess is that you have gyro rotation backwards. When you rotate counter-clockwise (left) the value should get larger. Take a look a the docs here .

The Pigeon IMU (a.k.a. Pigeon 1) value needs to be inverted to match what WPILib expects. The Pigeon 2 has a getRotation2d() method in Phoenix 6 that does this for you.

EDIT: It seems like you have a Pigeon 2, because you mention CAN wires. The Pigeon IMU (Pigeon 1) has a ribbon cable that attaches to a Talon SRX.

link_counts.title: Coordinate System — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: i dont think it’s a code issue. It works the grand majority of time but on some occasions it stops receiving actual values for a whiles, then at a seemingly random moment, it kicks back in. We got tired of this and are not far from comp so we simply changed our encoder to a NavX and have not had any issues since. Thank you!
i don’t think our coach would like us to share our code, but im positive its not a code issue. Thank you though!
no we have a pigeon IMU we simply found a way to wire it to the CAN in the docs below

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
Oh yes, I forgot you could also put the Pigeon IMU on CAN . Do make sure the rotation direction is CCW positive.

Do you get any CAN errors in the driverstation or riolog window? Maybe it’s intermittently having issues communicating.

We do sometimes get “CommandShceduler loop overrun” and something like internal print issues and we used to have problems with comm, but i think its been fixed with the right computer and the patch 1 from the NI tools (now patch 2) Although if you think it might be connected with those or other warnings from the driverstation  I could tell you if I recognize them. Thank you!
We have not had any issues with the NavX though, so we suspect it might be hardware issue.
